DataElement.preferredName: Bioelectrical Impedance Dual X-ray Absorptometry Total Body Fat Measurement Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric response that represents the percent of total body fat content calculated using measurements using a Dual X-ray Absorptometry.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bioelectrical Impedance Dual X-ray Absorptometry Total body fat Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Measurement of total body fat as determined by either dual xray absorptometry or bioelectrical impedence. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredName: Dual X-ray Absorptometry Bioelectric Impedance Analysis Total body fat
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured. (MedicineNet.com):A method to assess body composition, i.e., the relative percentages of body weight comprised of fat and fat-free body tissue.  It is based on the principle that the resistance to an applied electric current is inversely related to the amount of fat-free mass within the body. Impedance is greatest in fat tissue, which contains only 10-20% water, while fat-free mass, which contains 70-75% water, allows the signal to pass much more easily.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: A technique for scanning bone and measuring bone mineral density (BMD). A DXA scanner produces 2 X-ray beams, each with different energy levels. One beam is high energy while the other is low energy. The amount of x-rays that pass through the bone is measured for each beam. This will vary depending on the thickness of the bone. Based on the difference between the 2 beams, the bone density can be measured.

A method to assess body composition, i.e., the relative percentages of body weight comprised of fat tissue and lean body mass.  It is based on the principle that the resistance to an applied electric current is inversely related to the amount of lean body mass within the body. Impedance is greatest in fat tissue, which contains only 10-20% water, while lean body mass, which contains 70-75% water, allows the signal to pass much more easily.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

Concepts.definition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue composed of fat cells lodged in the meshes of areolar tissue.:A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A specialized form of connective tissue consisting primarily of adipocytes (fat cells), surrounded by a meshwork of collagen fibers.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
